018package org.tquadrat.foundation.util;
019
020import static java.lang.System.arraycopy;
021import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.STABLE;
022import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.requireNotEmptyArgument;
023import static org.tquadrat.foundation.util.StringUtils.format;
024
025import org.apiguardian.api.API;
026import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
027import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.UtilityClass;
028import org.tquadrat.foundation.exception.PrivateConstructorForStaticClassCalledError;
029import org.tquadrat.foundation.exception.ValidationException;
030
031/**
032 *  Library of utility methods useful in dealing with converting byte arrays
033 *  to and from strings of hexadecimal digits. <br>
034 *  <br>Parts of the code were adopted from the class
035 *  <code>org.apache.catalina.util.HexUtils</code> (written by Craig R.
036 *  McClanahan) out of the Tomcat source and modified to match the requirements
037 *  of this project.
038 *
039 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
040 *  @thanks Craig R. McClanahan
041 *  @version $Id: HexUtils.java 820 2020-12-29 20:34:22Z tquadrat $
042 *  @since 0.0.5
043 *
044 *  @UMLGraph.link
045 */
046@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: HexUtils.java 820 2020-12-29 20:34:22Z tquadrat $" )
047@UtilityClass
048public final class HexUtils
049{
050        /*--------------*\
051    ====** Constructors **=====================================================
052        \*--------------*/
053    /**
054     *  No instance of this class is allowed.
055     */
056    private HexUtils() { throw new PrivateConstructorForStaticClassCalledError( HexUtils.class ); }
057
058        /*---------*\
059    ====** Methods **==========================================================
060        \*---------*/
061    /**
062     *  Converts a String of hexadecimal digits into the corresponding byte
063     *  array by encoding each two hexadecimal digits as a byte. The method
064     *  will not distinguish between upper or lower case for the digit from
065     *  {@code 0xA} to {@code 0xF}.<br>
066     *  <br>If the number of digits in the String is odd, the String will be
067     *  <i>prefixed</i> by an additional 0.
068     *
069     *  @param  digits  Hexadecimal digits representation.
070     *  @return The resulting byte array.
071     *  @throws IllegalArgumentException The input String is {@code null},
072     *      empty, or it contains an invalid character that cannot be
073     *      interpreted as a hexadecimal digit.
074     */
075    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
076    public static byte[] convertFromHexString( final CharSequence digits )
077    {
078        final var len = requireNotEmptyArgument( digits, "digits" ).length();
079        final var digitsString = digits.toString();
080        final var chars = ((len % 2) == 0) ? digitsString.toCharArray() : ("0" + digitsString).toCharArray();
081        final var retValue = convertFromHexCharArray( chars );
082
083        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
084        return retValue;
085    }   //  convertFromHexString()
086
087    /**
088     *  Converts an array of hexadecimal digits into the corresponding byte
089     *  array by encoding each two hexadecimal digits as a byte. The method
090     *  will not distinguish between upper or lower case for the digit from
091     *  {@code 0xA} to {@code 0xF}.<br>
092     *  <br>If the number of digits in the array is odd, an additional 0 will
093     *  <i>prepended</i> to it.
094     *
095     *  @param  digits  Hexadecimal digits representation.
096     *  @return The resulting byte array.
097     *  @throws IllegalArgumentException The input array is {@code null},
098     *      empty, or it contains an invalid character that cannot be
099     *      interpreted as a hexadecimal digit.
100     */
101    @SuppressWarnings( {"MethodCanBeVariableArityMethod", "MagicNumber"} )
102    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
103    public static final byte[] convertFromHexCharArray( final char [] digits )
104    {
105        var len = requireNotEmptyArgument( digits, "digits" ).length;
106        final var f = new byte [] {16, 1};
107
108        char [] chars = null;
109        if( (len % 2) == 0 )
110        {
111            chars = digits;
112        }
113        else
114        {
115            chars = new char [len + 1];
116            chars [0] = '0';
117            arraycopy( digits, 0, chars, 1, len );
118            ++len;
119        }
120        final var retValue = new byte [len / 2];
121        byte resultByte;
122        char currentChar;
123        var rIndex = 0;  //  Index for retValue array.
124        int v;
125
126        ScanLoop:for( var i = 0; i < len; i += 2 )
127        {
128            resultByte = 0;
129
130            //---* Convert the digits *----------------------------------------
131            ConvertLoop: for( var j = 0; j < 2; ++j )
132            {
133                currentChar = chars [i + j];
134                v = Character.digit( currentChar, 0x10 );
135                if( v >= 0 )
136                {
137                    resultByte += v * f [j];
138                }
139                else
140                {
141                    throw new IllegalArgumentException( format( "The HexString '%1$S' contains an invalid character: %2$S", new String( digits ), Character.toString( currentChar ) ) );
142                }
143            }   //  ConvertLoop:
144
145            //---* Write the resulting byte *----------------------------------
146            retValue [rIndex++] = resultByte;
147        }   //  ScanLoop:
148
149        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
150        return retValue;
151    }   //  convertFromHexCharArray()
152
153    /**
154     *  Converts an integer in the range form 0 to 15 to a hex digit.
155     *
156     *  @param  value   The value to convert.
157     *  @return The hex digit (uppercase).
158     */
159    @SuppressWarnings( "MagicNumber" )
160    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
161    public static final char convertToHexDigit( final int value )
162    {
163        if( (value < 0) || (value > 15) )
164        {
165            throw new ValidationException( format( "The value %1$d cannot be converted to a single HexDigit", value ) );
166        }
167
168        final var temp = value & 15;
169        final var retValue = (char) (temp >= 10 ? ((temp - 10) + 'A') : (temp + '0'));
170
171        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
172        return retValue;
173    }   //  convertToHexDigit()
174
175    /**
176     *  Converts an array of bytes to a hex string where the digits from
177     *  {@code 0xA} to {@code 0xF} are all uppercase.
178     *
179     *  @param  bytes   The byte array.
180     *  @return The converted string.
181     *  @throws IllegalArgumentException    The given byte array is
182     *      {@code null} or empty.
183     */
184    @SuppressWarnings( "MagicNumber" )
185    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
186    public static final String convertToHexString( final byte[] bytes ) throws IllegalArgumentException
187    {
188        final var buffer = new StringBuilder( requireNotEmptyArgument( bytes, "bytes" ).length * 2 );
189        int i;
190        for( final var b : bytes )
191        {
192            //---* Make sure that the value is in the range 0 < value < 256 *--
193            i = ((b + 256) % 256);
194
195            //---* Convert *---------------------------------------------------
196            buffer.append( convertToHexDigit( i >> 4 ) );
197            buffer.append( convertToHexDigit( i & 15 ) );
198        }
199        final var retValue = buffer.toString();
200
201        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
202        return retValue;
203    }   //  convertToHexString()
204}
205//  class HexUtils
206
207/*
208 *  End of File
209 */
